en: Left alone, he began to read a book.
zh: 独自一人时，他开始读书。

en: I like to travel by myself.
zh: 我喜欢独自旅行。

en: Nothing is so pleasant as travelling alone.
zh: 没有比独自旅行更愉快的事了。

en: I got accustomed to living alone.
zh: 我习惯了独居。

en: Can you put on a kimono by yourself?
zh: 你能自己穿和服吗？

en: Is it dangerous to take a subway alone?
zh: 独自乘坐地铁危险吗？

en: One can't help many, but many can help one.
zh: 一人难帮众人，众人能帮一人。

en: It is lonely to live alone.
zh: 一个人生活很孤独。

en: Instead of going myself, I sent a messenger.
zh: 我没有亲自去，而是派了一个信使。

en: I'd rather stay home than go alone.
zh: 我宁愿待在家里也不愿独自去。

en: Let me go alone.
zh: 让我一个人去吧。

en: I don't want to go alone.
zh: 我不想一个人去。

en: She allowed him to go alone.
zh: 她允许他独自去。

en: It was careless of her to go out alone.
zh: 她独自外出太粗心了。

en: Though she wished to travel abroad by herself, she thought better of it.
zh: 虽然她希望独自出国旅行，但她后来改变了主意。

en: You cannot lift the piano alone.
zh: 你一个人搬不动这架钢琴。

en: I think it's dangerous to climb that mountain alone.
zh: 我认为独自攀登那座山很危险。

en: Can you move this desk by yourself?
zh: 你能自己搬动这张桌子吗？

en: Did you come here alone?
zh: 你是一个人来的吗？

en: One person more or less doesn't make much difference.
zh: 多一个人少一个人没什么区别。

en: Each individual paid 1,000 dollars.
zh: 每个人支付了1000美元。

en: The admission is ten dollars a person.
zh: 入场费每人十美元。

en: For personal reasons.
zh: 因为个人原因。

en: It's good to be able to concentrate single-mindedly on your work, but you're completely ignoring the people around you.
zh: 能够全神贯注于你的工作是件好事，但你完全忽略了你周围的人。

en: It won't hurt you to skip one meal.
zh: 少吃一顿饭不会伤害你。

en: Take me with you.
zh: 带我一起去。

en: Won't you come with me?
zh: 你跟我一起去好不好？

en: Come with me, will you?
zh: 跟我一起去，好吗？

en: I'm sorry for your not having come with us.
zh: 很遗憾你没能和我们一起去。

en: Would you play with me?
zh: 你愿意和我一起玩吗？

en: Won't you go shopping with me?
zh: 你愿意和我一起去购物吗？

en: I'm looking forward to serving your company.
zh: 我期待着为贵公司服务。

en: Working together, they cleaned the entire house in no time.
zh: 他们一起合作，很快就把整个房子打扫干净了。

en: He was always pulling my leg when we worked together.
zh: 我们一起工作的时候，他总是开我的玩笑。

en: Come along with me and go fishing.
zh: 跟我一起去钓鱼吧。

en: Do you mind if I join your trip to the country?
zh: 你介意我加入你们的乡村旅行吗？

en: What do you say to going fishing with me?
zh: 和我一起去钓鱼怎么样？

en: May I run with you?
zh: 我可以和你一起跑步吗？

en: What do you say to dining out together?
zh: 一起出去吃饭怎么样？

en: Would you like to have lunch together?
zh: 你想一起吃午饭吗？

en: How about eating out with me?
zh: 和我一起出去吃饭怎么样？

en: Can I take your picture with us?
zh: 我可以和你一起合影吗？

en: Let us go together. We can swim across the river, carry off the bear cubs, take them to the house on the mountain, and together find happiness.
zh: 我们一起走吧。我们可以一起游过河，把小熊崽带走，带到山上的房子里，一起寻找幸福。

en: I wish I could go with you, but as it is, I can't.
zh: 我真希望可以和你一起去，但实际上，我不能。

en: I would like to go with you.
zh: 我想和你一起去。

en: Do you want to come along?
zh: 你想一起来吗？

en: Let's work together to do our best.
zh: 让我们一起努力做到最好。

en: Put it on one bill, please.
zh: 请开在一张账单上。

en: Let's sing some English songs together.
zh: 我们一起唱一些英文歌吧。

en: Will you join us for a swim?
zh: 你愿意和我们一起游泳吗？

en: Would you like to go swimming with us?
zh: 你想和我们一起去游泳吗？

en: Would you like to go see a movie with me?
zh: 你想和我一起去看电影吗？

en: Will you join me for a drink?
zh: 要不要和我一起喝一杯？

en: She told him once and for all that she would not go to the movie with him.
zh: 她彻底地告诉他，她不会和他一起去看电影。

en: Why don't you come in for a cup of coffee and a chat?
zh: 要不要进来喝杯咖啡聊聊天？

en: When we are with a person we don't want to be seen with, we often meet someone we know.
zh: 当我们和不想见到的人在一起时，我们经常会遇到认识的人。

en: Do you want to come along and give it a go?
zh: 你想一起去试试吗？

en: I'm coming with you.
zh: 我和你一起去。

en: Shall I go together with you?
zh: 要我和你一起去吗？

en: Hard work has brought him success.
zh: 努力工作给他带来了成功。

en: With great effort he climbed up the tree.
zh: 他费了很大的劲才爬上树。

en: A moment's hesitation may cost a pilot his life.
zh: 片刻的犹豫可能会让飞行员丧命。

en: I must have stolen it when I lost control of myself momentarily.
zh: 我一定是失去理智的时候偷的。

en: There was a momentary pause.
zh: 有一个短暂的停顿。

en: For a moment, he thought of going after the man.
zh: 有一瞬间，他想追那个人。

en: We have used our ration of coal for the week.
zh: 我们已经用完了这周的煤配额。

en: I was in the hospital for a week.
zh: 我在医院住了一个星期。

en: We plan to stay a week.
zh: 我们计划待一个星期。

en: A week's reflection led to a new plan.
zh: 一周的反思促成了一个新的计划。

en: I will give you back the CD in a week.
zh: 我一个星期后还你CD。

en: It kept raining for a week.
zh: 一直下了一个星期的雨。

en: Don't commit yourself to doing it within a week.
zh: 不要承诺在一周内完成它。

en: We are able to deliver within a week.
zh: 我们可以在一周内交货。

en: I'll finish the work in a week or less.
zh: 我会在一周或更短的时间内完成这项工作。

en: I went without food for a week.
zh: 我一个星期没吃饭。

en: There are seven days in a week.
zh: 一个星期有七天。

en: I would like a week off with pay.
zh: 我想要带薪休假一周。

en: He took a week off.
zh: 他休假一周。

en: How many days a week do you go to school?
zh: 你一周上几天学？

en: How often a week do you take a bath?
zh: 你一周洗几次澡？

en: We have five English classes a week.
zh: 我们一周有五节英语课。

en: You can read ten books in a week? Don't you mean in a month?
zh: 你一周能读十本书？你是不是说一个月？

en: I will lend you some money, on condition that you will repay it in a week.
zh: 我可以借给你一些钱，条件是你一周内还清。

en: We had to learn the lines of the play in park.
zh: 我们不得不在一周内学会剧本的台词。

en: I shall see him in less than a week.
zh: 我将在不到一周的时间内见到他。

en: The weather has been nice all week.
zh: 这周天气一直很好。

en: I'd been on my own all week and was starving for conversation.
zh: 我整个星期都是一个人，渴望与人交谈。

en: It's a temporary condition.
zh: 这是一种暂时的情况。

en: For a while, I was really into cola- drinking it every day.
zh: 有一段时间，我真的很喜欢喝可乐，每天都喝。

en: I waited for an hour, but he didn't appear.
zh: 我等了一个小时，但他没有出现。

en: I've been waiting for one and a half-hours.
zh: 我已经等了一个半小时了。

en: I met her an hour ago.
zh: 我一个小时前遇到了她。

en: It stopped snowing an hour ago.
zh: 一个小时前停止下雪了。

en: An hour's drive brought us to the airport.
zh: 一个小时的车程把我们带到了机场。

en: I've been waiting for you for over an hour.
zh: 我已经等你一个多小时了。

en: I'll be back within an hour.
zh: 我会在一个小时内回来。

en: Ten to one it'll clear up in an hour or so.
zh: 十有八九一个小时左右就会放晴。

en: Scarcely an hour goes by that I don't I think of you with love.
zh: 几乎每过一个小时，我都会充满爱意地想起你。

en: Will you lend me your bicycle for an hour?
zh: 你可以把你的自行车借给我一个小时吗？

en: He should get to your house in an hour.
zh: 他应该在一个小时内到达你家。

en: Do you think you can make out the list in an hour?
zh: 你觉得你能在一个小时内抄写完这份清单吗？

en: Please cover for me at the reception desk for about one hour.
zh: 请你在接待处替我值班大约一个小时。

en: He who steals a pin will steal an ox.
zh: 偷针者偷牛。

en: Nothing succeeds like success.
zh: 一顺百顺。

en: At one time we were enemies, but we've buried the hatchet and we are now on friendly terms with each other.
zh: 我们曾经是敌人，但我们已经化干戈为玉帛，现在彼此关系友好了。

en: For a guy who was chosen by his father as the only son to be taught the secrets of this martial art, he doesn't have much of a kick.
zh: 作为一个被父亲选为唯一传授这门武术秘诀的儿子的人来说，他踢得不怎么样。

en: I can't afford $40 for one book!
zh: 我买不起一本书要40美元！

en: I arrived at Narita the day before yesterday.
zh: 我前天到达了成田机场。

en: It has been raining since the day before yesterday, but it may clear up this afternoon.
zh: 从前天开始就一直在下雨，但今天下午可能会放晴。

en: It has been raining on and off since the day before yesterday.
zh: 从前天开始就断断续续地下雨。

en: I received your letter the day before yesterday.
zh: 我前天收到了你的信。

en: They left there the day before yesterday.
zh: 他们前天离开了那里。

en: He may have absented himself from school the day before yesterday.
zh: 他前天可能旷课了。

en: The day before yesterday we arrived at Osaka.
zh: 前天我们到达了大阪。

en: I met her by chance on the train the day before yesterday.
zh: 前天我在火车上偶然遇到了她。

en: The economic strength of a country lies not alone in its ability to produce, but also in its capacity to consume.
zh: 一个国家的经济实力不仅在于其生产能力，还在于其消费能力。

en: It is important for a nation to have an adequate mix of monetary and fiscal policies.
zh: 一个国家拥有适当的货币和财政政策组合非常重要。

en: The amount of paper produced by a country is closely related to its cultural standards.
zh: 一个国家生产的纸张数量与其文化水平密切相关。

en: We should lose no time in leaving here.
zh: 我们应该抓紧时间离开这里。

en: Not a moment could be lost.
zh: 一刻也不能耽误。

en: There is no time to be lost.
zh: 时不我待。

en: The party returned safe and sound.
zh: 这行人安然无恙地回来了。

en: The party went to China by sea.
zh: 这行人乘船去了中国。

en: The party set out for Kobe.
zh: 这行人出发去神户了。

en: The party reached the mountaintop yesterday.
zh: 这行人昨天到达了山顶。

en: The party arrived at Kyoto.
zh: 队伍抵达了京都。

en: The party fought their way up.
zh: 队伍一路奋战前进。

en: The party went forward in the face of danger.
zh: 队伍不畏艰险，勇往直前。

en: The party set out regardless of the bad weather.
zh: 队伍不顾恶劣天气出发了。

en: The party started for New York.
zh: 队伍启程前往纽约。

en: The party flew nonstop from New York to Paris.
zh: 队伍从纽约直飞巴黎。

en: The party did not succeed in climbing the mountain.
zh: 队伍未能成功登上那座山。

en: The party stayed in Kyoto for a short period.
zh: 队伍在京都停留了很短一段时间。

en: The party crossed over to America.
zh: 队伍横渡到了美国。

en: They are a party of six.
zh: 他们一行六人。

en: The party walked down the mountain.
zh: 队伍走下了山。

en: The party started soon after his arrival.
zh: 队伍在他到达后不久就出发了。

en: The party, therefore, had to take another route.
zh: 因此，队伍不得不选择另一条路线。

en: The leader of the party is a famous scientist.
zh: 这个队伍的领导者是一位著名的科学家。

en: Write on every other line.
zh: 隔行书写。

en: The seats were reserved for the party.
zh: 座位是为这伙人预留的。

en: Can I have a bite?
zh: 我可以咬一口吗？

en: Write on alternate lines.
zh: 隔行书写。

en: Many were eager to get in on the act.
zh: 许多人都渴望参与其中。

en: They all get lumped together as English texts. But in fact these books are extremely varied and wide-ranging.
zh: 它们都被笼统地归为英语文本。但事实上，这些书的内容极其多样且范围广泛。

en: I will bite just a little bit.
zh: 我只咬一小口。

en: Greta chugged the beer in one gulp.
zh: 格雷塔一口气喝光了啤酒。

en: A bare word of criticism makes her nervous.
zh: 仅仅是一点点批评就让她感到紧张。

en: I'll give you a piece of advice.
zh: 我给你一个建议。

en: Let me give you a piece of advice.
zh: 让我给你一个建议。

en: Let me say.
zh: 我说一句。

en: You have something to say about everything, don't you?
zh: 你对什么事都有话说，不是吗？

en: He didn't say a word.
zh: 他一句话也没说。

en: In a word, she isn't any use.
zh: 总而言之，她毫无用处。

en: In a word, he is a man of genius.
zh: 总而言之，他是个天才。

en: In a word, he is a coward.
zh: 总而言之，他是个懦夫。

en: In a word, you are in the wrong.
zh: 总而言之，你错了。

en: In a word, it's ridiculous.
zh: 总而言之，这太荒谬了。

en: In a word, I think he's a fool.
zh: 总而言之，我认为他是个傻瓜。

en: Off hand, I'd say her problem is shyness.
zh: 我立刻就说，她的问题是害羞。

en: An apparently small event may lead to a great result.
zh: 一件看似很小的事情可能会导致巨大的结果。

en: I saw at a glance that the empty house was badly in need of repair.
zh: 我一眼就看出这栋空房子急需修理。

en: I saw at a glance that there was something the matter with my father.
zh: 我一眼就看出我父亲有什么不对劲。

en: At first sight, the question seemed easy.
zh: 乍一看，这个问题似乎很容易。

en: Nothing could be more reasonable, on the face of it.
zh: 表面上看，没有什么比这更合理的了。

en: January is the first month of the year.
zh: 一月是一年中的第一个月。

en: At first sight, he seemed kind and gentle.
zh: 乍一看，他似乎很善良和温柔。

en: Women who, at first glance, appear to be completely ordinary also don't seem to be in that much of a rush to get married.
zh: 那些乍一看似乎完全普通的女性，似乎也不太急于结婚。

en: We have snow in January.
zh: 我们一月份下雪。

en: I'm taking an exam in January.
zh: 我一月份要参加考试。

en: It is important to be accomplished in some art.
zh: 精通一门艺术很重要。

en: Will you listen to a piece of music?
zh: 你愿意听一首曲子吗？

en: Please sing a song.
zh: 请唱首歌。

en: I want to sing a song.
zh: 我想唱首歌。

en: Let's take a rest.
zh: 我们休息一下吧。

en: How about taking a rest?
zh: 休息一下怎么样？

en: Take a rest, or you will be worn out.
zh: 休息一下吧，不然你会累垮的。

en: She came alive after taking a rest.
zh: 休息之后，她又恢复了活力。

en: I paid in a lump sum when I bought a television set.
zh: 我买电视机的时候一次性付清了。

en: Once you skip a lesson, it's hard to catch up with your classmates.
zh: 一旦你错过一节课，就很难赶上你的同学了。

en: The family had a hard time after the war.
zh: 战争结束后，这个家庭度过了一段艰难的时期。

en: They moved to New York, but adapted easily to their new surroundings.
zh: 他们搬到了纽约，但很快就适应了新的环境。

en: Except for Tom, the family was all watching TV in silence.
zh: 除了汤姆，全家人都在沉默地看电视。

en: The family moved from their native Germany to Chicago around the year 1830.
zh: 大约在1830年，这家人从他们的家乡德国搬到了芝加哥。

en: He is the black sheep of the family.
zh: 他是家里的败家子。

en: The whole family is out for a walk.
zh: 全家出去散步了。

en: I went to the South Pacific for a summer of romantic adventure.
zh: 我去南太平洋度过了一个充满浪漫冒险的夏天。

en: Count as one fractions of half a yen and over, but ignore those of less.
zh: 超过半日元的零头算一日元，不足半日元的忽略不计。

en: The sky looks threatening.
zh: 天空看起来阴沉沉的。

en: A really perceptive person can figure out a whole situation with just a few clues. That's the kind of person I want you to become.
zh: 一个真正有洞察力的人，仅凭一些线索就能弄清楚整个情况。我希望你成为那样的人。

en: A word is enough to a wise man.
zh: 智者一语足矣。

en: I don't like being made a fool of.
zh: 我不喜欢被人当傻瓜耍。

en: I'll tell you a story.
zh: 我给你讲个故事。

en: I'll give you a piece of good advice.
zh: 我给你一个忠告。

en: One important thing to remember is that Americans may remain silent when you say something they don't agree with.
zh: 要记住的一件重要的事情是，当美国人不同意你说的话时，他们可能会保持沉默。

en: May I ask a favor of you?
zh: 我可以请你帮个忙吗？

en: A single mistake, and you are a failure.
zh: 一次失误，你就失败了。

en: A miss is as good as a mile.
zh: 失之毫厘，差之千里。

en: One is new, and the other is old.
zh: 一个是新的，一个是旧的。

en: This carpet is one of the most beautiful.
zh: 这张地毯是最漂亮的之一。

en: You should concentrate on one thing and learn to do it well.
zh: 你应该专注于一件事，并学会把它做好。

en: An idea occurred to me.
zh: 我突然想到一个主意。

en: To know a language is one thing, and to teach it is another.
zh: 懂一门语言是一回事，教它又是另一回事。

en: For one thing, he thinks she is stupid, for another, he doesn't like her.
zh: 一方面，他觉得她很笨，另一方面，他不喜欢她。

en: For one thing, I am poor; for another, I am busy.
zh: 一方面，我很穷；另一方面，我很忙。

en: For one thing, I'm penniless; for another, I don't have the time.
zh: 一方面，我身无分文；另一方面，我没有时间。

en: For one thing, I couldn't afford to do that.
zh: 一方面，我负担不起那样做。

en: For one thing, I've no money, and for another, I've no leisure.
zh: 一方面，我没钱，另一方面，我没空闲时间。

en: This is true partly because non-Westerners have begun to take pride in their own cultures and partly because those areas of the world where forks are not used have some of the highest birth rates.
zh: 部分原因是，非西方人已经开始为自己的文化感到自豪，部分原因是，世界上不使用叉子的地区生育率最高。

en: Would you do me a favor?
zh: 你能帮我个忙吗？

en: May I ask you to do me a favor?
zh: 我可以请你帮我个忙吗？

en: I have a favor to ask of you.
zh: 我有个忙想请你帮。

en: Not a drop of rain fell for a month, so they had to dig a well.
zh: 一个月没下一滴雨，所以他们不得不挖井。

en: You'll make a fortune by taking a chance.
zh: 冒险一试，你会发大财的。

en: The Isonos would often go hiking.
zh: 伊索诺一家经常去徒步旅行。

en: I feel exactly the same as Mr Isoda.
zh: 我和伊佐田先生的感觉完全一样。

en: Child-care leave and time off to care for the aged are needed in order to respond to demographic changes now taking place in Japan.
zh: 为了应对日本现在正在发生的人口结构变化，需要育儿假和照顾老人的休假。

en: A growing child requires more food.
zh: 成长中的孩子需要更多的食物。

en: Mr Iuchi has no one to fall back on.
zh: 井内先生没有可以依靠的人。

en: Inoue doesn't like computers.
zh: 井上不喜欢电脑。

en: A well is a place where you can get water.
zh: 井是可以取水的地方。

en: He died without having made a will.
zh: 他没有立遗嘱就去世了。

en: I'm sorry to say, but the service isn't very good.
zh: 很抱歉，但这里的服务不太好。

en: I regret to inform you that I will be unable to keep our appointment for February 27.
zh: 我很遗憾地通知您，我将无法赴2月27日的约会。

en: I was fined 20 dollars for illegal parking.
zh: 我因非法停车被罚款20美元。

en: You really shouldn't use pirated software.
zh: 你真的不应该使用盗版软件。

en: Wrong.
zh: 错误。

en: The speeding vehicle skidded and crashed head-on into the rear-end of a truck before the driver could say Jack Robinson.
zh: 那辆超速行驶的车辆在司机还没反应过来之前就打滑并正面撞上了一辆卡车的尾部。

en: No. I don't know. It's a lot of things.
zh: 不，我不知道。情况很复杂。

en: No, no, no!
zh: 不，不，不！

en: The difference is this: he works harder than you.
zh: 区别在于：他比你更努力。

en: I came to the realization too late to make a difference.
zh: 我醒悟得太晚，已经无法改变了。

en: In spite of their various differences, Joan and Ann are friends.
zh: 尽管琼和安有种种不同，她们仍然是朋友。

en: We have an oversupply of clothing.
zh: 我们的服装供过于求。

en: We must make economies in buying clothes.
zh: 我们必须在购买服装方面节省开支。

en: Please get dressed.
zh: 请穿好衣服。

en: If you look after your clothes, they last a lot longer.
zh: 如果你爱护你的衣服，它们会穿得更久。

en: What do you do with your clothes when they are worn out?
zh: 你的旧衣服都怎么处理？

en: The identity of the lost child was confirmed by its clothes.
zh: 通过衣服确认了走失儿童的身份。

en: It is hard for an empty sack to stand straight.
zh: 空袋子很难站直。

en: Food, clothing and shelter are the basis of life.
zh: 食物、衣服和住所是生活的基础。

en: Food and clothes are necessities of life.
zh: 食物和衣服是生活必需品。

en: In the matter of food and clothing, we are pretty well off.
zh: 在食物和衣服方面，我们相当富裕。

en: What is indispensable to our lives, along with food and clothes, is housing.
zh: 对我们的生活来说，除了食物和衣服之外，不可或缺的是住房。

en: The dress does not make the fair.
zh: 人不可貌相。

en: Could you send up some stomach medicine?
zh: 能送点胃药上来吗？

en: I want to see a doctor about my stomach-ache.
zh: 我想找医生看看我的胃痛。

en: The belly has no ears.
zh: 肚子不听劝。（比喻饿了就要吃）

en: I suffer from a stomach ache.
zh: 我肚子疼。

en: The stomach is one of the internal organs.
zh: 胃是内脏器官之一。

en: The pain in my stomach has gone.
zh: 我胃里的疼痛已经消失了。

en: Something is the matter with my stomach.
zh: 我的胃有点不舒服。

en: An ulcer forms in the stomach.
zh: 胃里形成了一个溃疡。

en: I got a stomach tumor and had to have it operated on.
zh: 我得了胃肿瘤，不得不做手术。

en: I have a pressing feeling in my stomach.
zh: 我感到胃里有压迫感。

en: My stomach hurts.
zh: 我胃疼。

en: Do you feel any pain in your stomach?
zh: 你感觉胃里有什么疼痛吗？

en: My stomach feels heavy.
zh: 我感觉胃里很沉重。

en: I'm afraid I have an upset stomach.
zh: 恐怕我得了胃病。

en: My stomach is rumbling.
zh: 我的肚子在咕咕叫。

en: Getting a sports car is easy, compared to the maintenance one must do on it.
zh: 买一辆跑车很容易，但和之后必须做的维护相比，就难多了。

en: The emigrants have endured physical and mental pain.
zh: 移民们忍受了身体和精神上的痛苦。

en: Immigrants streamed into the land.
zh: 移民涌入这片土地。

en: Due to our office moving, we will be closed from May 30 to 31.
zh: 由于我们办公室搬迁，我们将于5月30日至31日关闭。

en: Migrants from the continent crossed the Japan sea.
zh: 来自大陆的移民横渡日本海。

en: Years of resistance to misfortune ended when the settlers' village was overcome by the savages and their hopes and lives came to the bitter end.
zh: 多年来对不幸的抵抗在定居者的村庄被野蛮人征服时结束了，他们的希望和生命也走到了尽头。

en: There is no objection on my part.
zh: 我没有异议。

en: If there is no objection, we will close the meeting now.
zh: 如果没有异议，我们现在就结束会议。

en: A strange sight greeted her eyes.
zh: 一个奇怪的景象映入她的眼帘。

en: It's very difficult to communicate with people from other cultures.
zh: 与来自其他文化的人交流非常困难。

en: It is generally hard to adapt to living in a foreign culture.
zh: 通常很难适应在异国文化中生活。

en: As for the accusations of heresy, here the evidence is much weaker.
zh: 至于关于异端的指控，这里的证据要薄弱得多。

en: Unusually low temperatures account for the poor rice crop this year.
zh: 今年异常低的温度是造成稻米歉收的原因。

en: Is everything all right?
zh: 一切都好吗？

en: The streets are filled with an air of exoticism.
zh: 街道上弥漫着异国情调。

en: They went ahead with the plan since there were no objections.
zh: 由于没有异议，他们继续执行了该计划。

en: The exchange rates are posted daily outside the cashier's office.
zh: 兑换率每天都张贴在收银员办公室外面。

en: The rate of exchange is 145 yen to the dollar.
zh: 汇率是1美元兑145日元。

en: Choose such friends as will benefit you, they say. That is why I am on intimate terms with Mr Aoki.
zh: 他们说，要选择对你有益的朋友。所以我才和青木先生关系密切。

en: How do I fix the seat?
zh: 我该怎么修理这个座位？

en: He who can, does. He who cannot, teaches.
zh: 能者居之，不能者教之。

en: It is under the chair.
zh: 在椅子下面。

en: No sooner had I sat down and relaxed than the phone rang.
zh: 我刚坐下放松，电话就响了。

en: Two seats were vacant.
zh: 有两个空位。

en: You may sit down on the chair.
zh: 你可以坐在椅子上。

en: The chair hasn't arrived yet.
zh: 椅子还没到。

en: Written as it is in easy style, the book is for beginners.
zh: 这本书文笔流畅，适合初学者。

en: Could you say that in plain English?
zh: 你能用简单易懂的英语说一遍吗？

en: Written in plain English, the book can be read even by you.
zh: 这本书用简单的英语写的，即使你也能读懂。

en: It is often pointed out that a vague smile is typical of the Japanese.
zh: 人们常常指出，含糊的微笑是日本人的典型特征。

en: It is difficult to convey the meaning exactly.
zh: 很难准确地传达这个意思。

en: Everything that has meaning can be called language.
zh: 一切有意义的东西都可以称为语言。

en: In the main, I am in favor of political reform if meaningful changes are made.
zh: 总的来说，如果能做出有意义的改变，我赞成政治改革。

en: I'm catching on.
zh: 我明白了。

en: I didn't catch the meaning.
zh: 我没听懂意思。

en: Although he isn't ill-natured, he is not very kind.
zh: 虽然他没有恶意，但他不是很友善。

en: The wicked witch cast an evil spell on the man and turned him into an insect.
zh: 邪恶的女巫对那个人下了恶毒的咒语，把他变成了一只昆虫。

en: It had an effect alien from the one intended.
zh: 它产生了与预期效果相反的结果。

en: The unconscious person feels no pain, but for the family and friends it can be a long and painful experience.
zh: 失去知觉的人感觉不到疼痛，但对于家人和朋友来说，这可能是一段漫长而痛苦的经历。

en: People who are unconscious can't say they want to die.
zh: 失去知觉的人不能说他们想死。

en: He'll make a good husband.
zh: 他会是个好丈夫。

en: I lost consciousness.
zh: 我失去了知觉。

en: She is unconscious.
zh: 她失去知觉了。

en: There is one thing which we do every time we read, whether we are aware of it or not; we come in contact with the personality of the writer.
zh: 每次阅读时，无论我们是否意识到，我们都会做一件事：与作者的个性产生接触。

en: Communication takes many forms.
zh: 沟通有很多种形式。

en: Where communications fail, so do activities.
zh: 沟通失败的地方，活动也会失败。

en: A man of weak will is the target of criticism; even his friends would badger him into correcting his defects.
zh: 意志薄弱的人是批评的目标；甚至他的朋友也会劝他改正缺点。

en: A man of strong will is not subject to corruption.
zh: 意志坚强的人不会被腐蚀。

en: No one can force you to do anything against your will.
zh: 没有人可以强迫你做任何违背你意愿的事情。

en: Knowing their languages is not enough to communicate effectively, because the methods of communication are determined by their cultures.
zh: 仅仅了解他们的语言不足以进行有效的沟通，因为沟通方式是由他们的文化决定的。

en: Through communication we are able to learn about each other.
zh: 通过沟通，我们能够互相了解。

en: We use words in order to communicate.
zh: 我们使用文字来进行沟通。

en: Having no will is the worst handicap.
zh: 没有意志是最糟糕的缺陷。

en: The weak-willed are prone to go to the dogs; the strong-willed turn failure into success.
zh: 意志薄弱的人容易堕落；意志坚强的人会将失败转化为成功。

en: I could not help but state my opinion.
zh: 我忍不住表达了我的意见。

en: Opinion is ultimately determined by the feelings, and not by the intellect.
zh: 意见最终是由感觉决定的，而不是由智力决定的。

en: Never identify opinions with facts.
zh: 永远不要将意见与事实混淆。

en: Anyone with an opinion please raise their hand.
zh: 有意见的人请举手。

en: Surprisingly, he is the type that worries about being in the public eye.
zh: 令人惊讶的是，他是那种担心出现在公众视野中的人。

en: You know something?
zh: 你知道吗？

en: Unexpectedly the weather forecast came true yesterday.
zh: 出乎意料的是，昨天的天气预报应验了。

en: Unexpected results were announced.
zh: 宣布了意想不到的结果。

en: You don't say.
zh: 不会吧。

en: The committee picked the site for the exhibition.
zh: 委员会选择了展览的场地。

en: The chairman is elected for a two year term.
zh: 主席的任期为两年。

en: The committee returned to their seats.
zh: 委员会回到了他们的座位。

en: The committee are all against it.
zh: 委员会都反对它。

en: The committee approved the draft budget.
zh: 委员会批准了预算草案。

en: The committee approved the budget.
zh: 委员会批准了预算。

en: The committee adjourned to another hall.
zh: 委员会转移到另一个大厅。

en: The committee eagerly welcomed her as chairperson.
zh: 委员会热情地欢迎她担任主席。

en: The committee elected him chairperson.
zh: 委员会选举他为主席。

en: The committee bestowed a medal on him.
zh: 委员会授予他一枚奖章。

en: The commission concluded that the answer was no.
zh: 委员会的结论是答案是否定的。

en: The committee is composed of three men and seven women.
zh: 委员会由三名男性和七名女性组成。

en: The committee comprises ten members.
zh: 委员会由十名成员组成。

en: Our committee consists of ten members.
zh: 我们的委员会由十名成员组成。

en: The committee is discussing social welfare.
zh: 委员会正在讨论社会福利。

en: The committee inquired into the cause of the accident.
zh: 委员会调查了事故的原因。

en: The committee is composed of five students.
zh: 委员会由五名学生组成。

en: The committee meets twice a month.
zh: 委员会每月开会两次。

en: The committee is composed of teachers and parents.
zh: 委员会由教师和家长组成。

en: The committee held a discussion on the problem of education.
zh: 委员会就教育问题进行了讨论。

en: A committee should apply the focus to the more concrete problem.
zh: 委员会应该将重点放在更具体的问题上。

en: The committee was not disposed to hold another meeting.
zh: 委员会不愿再次举行会议。

en: The committee has not yet arrived at a decision.
zh: 委员会尚未做出决定。

en: The committee will be opposed to the proposal.
zh: 委员会将反对这项提案。

en: The committee was split over the project.
zh: 委员会对该项目存在分歧。

en: The committee passed the bill.
zh: 委员会通过了该法案。

en: The committee decided to call off the strike.
zh: 委员会决定取消罢工。

en: The committee got down to business after coffee.
zh: 喝完咖啡后，委员会开始处理事务。

en: The committee meets today at four.
zh: 委员会今天四点开会。

en: The committee consists of eight members.
zh: 委员会由八名成员组成。

en: The committee divided into five sections.
zh: 委员会分为五个部分。

en: The committee adjourned for two weeks.
zh: 委员会休会两周。

en: The committee is made up of fifteen members.
zh: 委员会由十五名成员组成。

en: The committee consists of twelve members.
zh: 委员会由十二名成员组成。

en: The committee called on all nations to work side-by-side to curb air pollution.
zh: 委员会呼吁所有国家并肩努力，遏制空气污染。

en: The committee will meet next Friday.
zh: 委员会将于下周五开会。

en: The purpose of the committee is to develop children's musical talent.
zh: 委员会的目的是培养儿童的音乐才能。

en: All the members of the committee hate one another.
zh: 委员会的所有成员都互相憎恨。

en: The committee had a long session.
zh: 委员会举行了一次长时间的会议。

en: One of the committees is composed of eight members.
zh: 其中一个委员会由八名成员组成。

en: The members of the committee are all men.
zh: 委员会的成员都是男性。

en: All the members of the committee consented to my proposal.
zh: 委员会的所有成员都同意我的提议。

en: His influence in the committee became weaker and weaker.
zh: 他在委员会中的影响力越来越弱。

en: The committee was summoned at once.
zh: 委员会立即被召集。

en: The committee are all present.
zh: 委员会成员都到齐了。

en: The committee are all for the plan.
zh: 委员会成员都赞成这个计划。

en: The majority of the committee voted against the bill.
zh: 委员会的大多数成员投票反对该法案。

en: The committee stayed up late last night trying to work out measures that would please everyone.
zh: 委员会昨晚熬夜试图制定出让每个人都满意的措施。

en: The committee met and discussed whom to appoint to the post.
zh: 委员会开会讨论了任命谁担任该职位。

en: The point about enclosure is that the configuration of ethnic groups must be clearly described.
zh: 关于封闭的重点是，必须清楚地描述族群的构成。

en: The great critic and the poet are traveling together.
zh: 伟大的评论家和诗人正在一起旅行。

en: The great critic and poet is lecturing on philosophy.
zh: 伟大的评论家兼诗人正在讲授哲学。

en: The son of a great actor became a good actor in his own right.
zh: 一位伟大演员的儿子凭借自己的实力成为了一名优秀的演员。

en: Great geniuses have the shortest biographies.
zh: 伟大的天才都有最短的传记。

en: The great statesman and general is still living.
zh: 那位伟大的政治家和将军仍然健在。

en: You should read about the careers of great men.
zh: 你应该读一读伟人的生平。

en: Every great writer seems to have been interested in English.
zh: 似乎每个伟大的作家都对英语感兴趣。

en: Great scholar as he is, he is lacking in common sense.
zh: 他虽然是个伟大的学者，但缺乏常识。

en: A great scholar is not necessarily a good teacher.
zh: 伟大的学者不一定是好的老师。

en: Many great men went through hardship during their youth.
zh: 许多伟人在年轻时都经历过艰辛。

en: Great people are not always wise.
zh: 伟大的人并不总是明智的。

en: Great men are not always wise.
zh: 伟人并不总是明智的。

en: A great man doesn't care about his appearance.
zh: 一个伟大的人不在乎他的外表。

en: The client talked with the lawyer.
zh: 客户和律师谈过了。

en: On your marks, get set, go!
zh: 各就各位，预备，跑！

en: I still haven't heard from him.
zh: 我仍然没有收到他的消息。

en: Miss Ito made her students work hard.
zh: 伊东老师让她的学生努力学习。

en: Taro Ito was found guilty.
zh: 伊东太郎被判有罪。

en: Does Mr Ito teach history?
zh: 伊东老师教历史吗？

en: Mr Ito teaches history.
zh: 伊东老师教历史。

en: Mr Ito will call the roll.
zh: 伊东老师要点名了。

en: Mr Ito loosened his tie because he felt hot in his office.
zh: 伊东老师因为在办公室里感到热，所以松了松领带。

en: Talking of Mr Ito, what has become of his son?
zh: 说到伊东先生，他的儿子怎么样了？

en: Professor Ito went to the United States for the purpose of studying linguistics.
zh: 伊东教授为了研究语言学去了美国。

en: Mr Ito is a highly educated man.
zh: 伊东先生是一位受过高等教育的人。

en: Will you make an appointment with Mr Ito?
zh: 你能和伊东先生预约一下吗？

en: There is a Mr Ito who wants to see you.
zh: 有位伊东先生想见你。

en: I am very fond of lobsters, but they are very, very expensive.
zh: 我非常喜欢龙虾，但是它们非常非常贵。

en: We've been friends ever since.
zh: 我们从那时起就一直是朋友了。

en: Have you met her before?
zh: 你以前见过她吗？

en: I saw him at one time or another.
zh: 我曾经见过他。

en: Albumin was found in my urine before.
zh: 以前我的尿液里发现过白蛋白。

en: The knife we used to cut the bread with was sharp.
zh: 我们用来切面包的刀很锋利。

en: A hideous monster used to live there.
zh: 以前那里住着一个可怕的怪物。

en: There was a tall tree in front of my house.
zh: 我家门前曾经有一棵高大的树。

en: Having seen him before, I knew him at once.
zh: 因为以前见过他，所以我立刻认出了他。

en: You are much taller than you used to be.
zh: 你比以前高多了。

en: I'm not as rich as I was.
zh: 我没有以前那么富有了。

en: No one had ever thought of selling ice before.
zh: 以前从来没有人想过卖冰。

en: Now there is nothing but desert, where there used to be a fertile plain.
zh: 现在那里只有沙漠，而以前却是一片肥沃的平原。

en: I used to look up to him, but not anymore.
zh: 我曾经很尊敬他，但现在不了。

en: There used to be a big cherry tree at the back of my house.
zh: 我家后面以前有一棵很大的樱桃树。

en: There used to be big trees around my house.
zh: 我家周围以前有很多大树。

en: When I was a child, my mother would often read fairy tales to me.
zh: 小时候，我妈妈经常给我读童话故事。

en: In the past, there were no oral English classes in high school. Now many schools have oral communication classes.
zh: 过去，高中里没有口语课。现在很多学校都有口语交流课。

en: "He used to love me," she answered sadly.
zh: “他曾经爱过我，”她悲伤地回答。

en: He said he had been to Hawaii before.
zh: 他说他以前去过夏威夷。

en: I used to sit up late at night.
zh: 我以前常常熬夜。

en: I used to play with my sister in the park.
zh: 我以前经常和我的妹妹在公园里玩。

en: I used to go fishing quite often, but now I rarely go.
zh: 我以前经常去钓鱼，但现在很少去了。

en: It used to be thought that the earth was flat.
zh: 人们过去认为地球是平的。

en: There used to be a temple right here.
zh: 这里以前有一座寺庙。

en: I didn't used to smoke.
zh: 我以前不抽烟。

en: You used to smoke, didn't you?
zh: 你以前抽烟，不是吗？

en: There used to be a church here.
zh: 以前这里有个教堂。

en: There used to be a castle on this hill.
zh: 以前这座山上有个城堡。

en: There used to be a restaurant in front of this bus stop.
zh: 以前这个公交车站前面有个餐厅。

en: There used to be a hut about here.
zh: 以前这附近有个小屋。

en: There used to be a green field here; now there's a supermarket.
zh: 以前这里是一片绿地，现在变成了一家超市。

en: People used to travel on foot.
zh: 以前人们是步行旅行的。

en: I had mastitis before.
zh: 我以前得过乳腺炎。

en: Having seen him before, I recognized him.
zh: 因为以前见过他，所以我认出了他。

en: I easily found Mr. Harrington because I had seen him before.
zh: 我很容易就找到了哈林顿先生，因为我以前见过他。

en: I had met him once before.
zh: 我以前见过他一次。

en: Having been to the temple before, I know the way.
zh: 因为以前去过那个寺庙，所以我知道路。

en: I was bored because I had seen the movie before.
zh: 我很无聊，因为我以前看过这部电影了。

en: The situation has improved considerably compared with what it was.
zh: 情况比以前有了很大的改善。

en: It's better than it was before.
zh: 这比以前好多了。

en: I look very different.
zh: 我看起来很不一样。

en: There used to be a store right here.
zh: 以前这里有个商店。

en: As you have often been here before, show me around, please.
zh: 因为你以前经常来这里，请你带我四处看看。

en: There used to be a coffee shop near the park.
zh: 以前公园附近有个咖啡馆。

en: He didn't deny that he was formerly involved in the program.
zh: 他没有否认他以前参与过这个项目。

en: Having been caught in that situation before, I knew exactly what to do.
zh: 因为以前遇到过那种情况，所以我很清楚该怎么做。

en: There used to be lots of fireflies around here.
zh: 以前这附近有很多萤火虫。

en: There used to be a pond around here.
zh: 以前这附近有个池塘。

en: There used to be a small shrine around here.
zh: 以前这附近有个小神社。

en: There used to be a big pond around here.
zh: 以前这附近有个大池塘。

en: There used to be an old temple here.
zh: 以前这里有个古老的寺庙。

en: I've always wanted to meet you.
zh: 我一直都很想见你。

en: Haven't we met before?
zh: 我们以前是不是见过？

en: Have we met before?
zh: 我们以前见过吗？

en: Not having seen him before, I'll not be able to recognize him.
zh: 因为之前没见过他，所以我认不出他。

en: Not having seen her before, I did not know her.
zh: 因为之前没见过她，所以我不认识她。

en: It feels like I've seen her before.
zh: 我感觉我以前见过她。

en: I've been to Hokkaido before.
zh: 我以前去过北海道。

en: Is that all?
zh: 就这些吗？

en: I may have seen that film before, but I can hardly remember it.
zh: 我可能以前看过那部电影，但我几乎不记得了。

en: The following is his story.
zh: 下面是他的故事。

en: I'll never do this again.
zh: 我再也不会这样做了。

en: The following is a summary of the President's speech.
zh: 下面是总统演讲的摘要。

en: I would like to place an order for the following.
zh: 我想订购以下商品。

en: The explanation below was achieved by comparing and contrasting a variety of different theories.
zh: 下面的解释是通过比较和对比各种不同的理论得出的。

en: All you have to do is fill in the blanks below.
zh: 你只需要填写下面的空白。

en: The following passage is a quotation from a well-known fable.
zh: 以下段落摘自一个著名的寓言。

en: The following persons passed the examination.
zh: 以下人员通过了考试。

en: The data to be discussed below was collected in the following way.
zh: 下面要讨论的数据是以以下方式收集的。

en: The following is what he told me.
zh: 下面是他告诉我的。

en: The pommel horse requires more balance than strength.
zh: 鞍马比起力量更需要平衡。

en: That's just a shot in the dark. How do you think you'll succeed by just acting on the spur of the moment like that?
zh: 这只是瞎猜。你觉得你这样一时冲动就能成功吗？

en: It was a dark night.
zh: 那是一个漆黑的夜晚。

en: The darkness has not overcome it.
zh: 黑暗没有胜过它。

en: We could barely make out two figures in the dark.
zh: 我们在黑暗中几乎看不清两个人影。

en: Darkness is the absence of light.
zh: 黑暗是光的缺失。

en: Our guide misinformed us about the location of the hotel.
zh: 我们的导游错误地告诉了我们酒店的位置。

en: Could you send me a brochure?
zh: 可以寄给我一份宣传册吗？

en: Where's the information desk?
zh: 问讯处在哪里？

en: Where is the information counter?
zh: 咨询台在哪里？

en: Show me the way, will you?
zh: 请你给我指路好吗？

en: This book is surprisingly easy to read, isn't it?
zh: 这本书出乎意料地容易读，不是吗？

en: I have no plans whatever.
zh: 我没有任何计划。

en: Sure enough, the ghost appeared on the balcony.
zh: 果然，那个鬼魂出现在阳台上。

en: She called me up, as I had expected.
zh: 她给我打了电话，正如我所预料的那样。

en: As was to be expected, he took the first place.
zh: 不出所料，他得了第一名。

en: Sure enough, he entertained doubts.
zh: 果然，他心存疑虑。

en: Just like I thought, the contractor came back today, begging for more time.
zh: 果然不出我所料，承包商今天又回来了，恳求更多时间。

en: Fear often exaggerates danger.
zh: 恐惧常常夸大危险。

en: Please input your PIN number.
zh: 请输入您的密码。

en: I don't mind your groping in the dark for a solution, but I wish you'd come to a decision.
zh: 我不介意你暗中摸索寻找解决方案，但我希望你能做出决定。

en: Assassination has never changed the history of the world.
zh: 暗杀从未改变世界的历史。

en: The "prince of darkness" means Satan.
zh: “黑暗王子”指的是撒旦。

en: Encryption technology has advanced to the point where it's pretty reliable.
zh: 加密技术已经发展到非常可靠的地步。

en: A form appeared in the darkness.
zh: 黑暗中出现了一个身影。

en: We saw a dim light in the darkness.
zh: 我们在黑暗中看到了一丝微弱的光芒。

en: A tiny object moved in the dark.
zh: 一个微小的物体在黑暗中移动。

en: It was impossible for him to take the picture in the dark.
zh: 他不可能在黑暗中拍照。

en: I heard my name called in the dark.
zh: 我在黑暗中听到有人叫我的名字。

en: Something was stirring in the dark.
zh: 黑暗中有动静。

en: I was afraid of getting lost in the dark.
zh: 我害怕在黑暗中迷路。

en: A red light was glowing in the dark.
zh: 黑暗中亮着一盏红灯。

en: Somebody called my name in the dark.
zh: 黑暗中有人叫我的名字。

en: A pall of darkness cloaked the valley.
zh: 一层黑暗笼罩着山谷。

en: I spring out of the darkness.
zh: 我从黑暗中跳出来。

en: The robber emerged from the darkness.
zh: 强盗从黑暗中冒了出来。

en: It is too dark to play outside.
zh: 太黑了，没法在外面玩。

en: It is too dark to see clearly.
zh: 太黑了，看不清楚。

en: It is too dark to read a book there.
zh: 那里太黑了，没法看书。

en: It's too dark to play outside.
zh: 太黑了，没法在外面玩。

en: You'd better hurry up if you want to get home before dark.
zh: 如果你想在天黑前到家，最好快点。

en: I'll be back before dark.
zh: 我会在天黑前回来。

en: Come home before it gets dark.
zh: 天黑前回家。

en: I will return to the house before dark.
zh: 我会在天黑前回家的。

en: I want to reach the hotel before it gets dark.
zh: 我想在天黑前到达酒店。

en: All you have to do is wait until dark.
zh: 你所要做的就是等到天黑。

en: I waited for her till it got dark.
zh: 我一直等到天黑才等到她。

en: It was getting dark, and, what made matters worse, it began to rain.
zh: 天色渐晚，更糟糕的是，开始下雨了。

en: It got dark, and what was worse, it began to rain.
zh: 天黑了，更糟糕的是，开始下雨了。

en: Come home before dark.
zh: 天黑前回家。

en: I reached the village before dark.
zh: 我在天黑前到达了村庄。

en: We are likely to get there before dark.
zh: 我们很可能在天黑前到达那里。

en: I took the bus in order to reach the destination before it got dark.
zh: 为了在天黑前到达目的地，我坐了公共汽车。

en: It's getting dark. Please turn the light on for me.
zh: 天黑了。请帮我把灯打开。

en: It's getting dark. You'd better go home.
zh: 天黑了。你最好回家吧。

en: With darkness coming on, the children returned home.
zh: 随着夜幕降临，孩子们回家了。

en: It is getting darker. It may rain soon.
zh: 天色越来越暗了，可能很快就要下雨了。

en: It is getting dark. Let's go home.
zh: 天黑了，我们回家吧。

en: It grew dark, and what was worse, we lost our way.
zh: 天色暗了下来，更糟糕的是，我们迷路了。

en: Don't let her go out after dark.
zh: 天黑以后别让她出门。

en: Don't go out after it gets dark.
zh: 天黑以后别出门。

en: Don't go out after dark.
zh: 天黑以后别出门。

en: I don't like to go out after dark.
zh: 我不喜欢天黑以后出门。

en: You had better not go after dark.
zh: 你最好不要天黑以后去。

en: Don't walk alone after dark.
zh: 天黑以后不要独自走路。

en: As soon as it gets dark, the fireworks will start.
zh: 天一黑，烟花就开始放。

en: A car passed by in the dark.
zh: 一辆汽车在黑暗中驶过。

en: Not seeing anything in the dark, we couldn't move.
zh: 因为在黑暗中什么也看不见，我们无法移动。

en: She switched on the lamp because it was dark.
zh: 因为天黑了，她打开了灯。

en: It was dark, and I could not make out who was coming along the road.
zh: 天很黑，我看不清是谁沿着路走过来。

en: Dark as it was, we managed to find our way home.
zh: 尽管天很黑，我们还是设法找到了回家的路。

en: Dark as it was, we managed to find our way back to our tent.
zh: 尽管天很黑，我们还是设法找到了回到帐篷的路。

en: I shone a flashlight into the dark room.
zh: 我用手电筒照向黑暗的房间。

en: It's not good to read in a dark room.
zh: 在黑暗的房间里看书不好。

en: What are you looking for in the dark room?
zh: 你在黑暗的房间里找什么？

en: Watch your step in dark alleys.
zh: 在黑暗的小巷里小心脚下。

en: He lost his sense of direction in the dark woods.
zh: 他在黑暗的森林里迷失了方向。

en: Dark clouds are a sign of rain.
zh: 乌云是下雨的征兆。

en: On entering a dark tunnel, we could see nothing.
zh: 进入黑暗的隧道后，我们什么也看不见。

en: Don't read books in a dark place.
zh: 不要在黑暗的地方看书。

en: Buy cheap and waste your money.
zh: 贪小便宜吃大亏。

en: Cheap sake makes you sick.
zh: 廉价的清酒会让你生病。

en: Everybody speaks very highly of Ando.
zh: 大家都对安藤评价很高。

en: A recent analysis by Boeing forecasts that unless safety is improved, jet airliners could be falling out of the sky at the rate of once a week by the year 2010.
zh: 波音公司最近的一项分析预测，除非安全性得到提高，否则到2010年，喷气式客机可能会以每周一次的速度坠毁。

en: Take an amulet for safety's sake.
zh: 带一个护身符以保平安。

en: You may injure yourself if you don't follow safety procedures.
zh: 如果不遵守安全程序，你可能会受伤。

en: We will set up a notice in front of the machine for safety's sake.
zh: 为了安全起见，我们将在机器前面设置一个告示。

en: For safety purposes, remove the plastic casing before use.
zh: 为了安全起见，使用前请取下塑料外壳。

en: Steady the boat so we can get on safely.
zh: 稳住船，这样我们才能安全上船。

en: Excessive concern with safety can be dangerous.
zh: 过度关注安全可能很危险。

en: Have a safe trip.
zh: 祝你旅途平安。

en: You should drive at a safe speed.
zh: 你应该以安全的速度驾驶。

en: Organic vegetables are popular because they're safe and tasty.
zh: 有机蔬菜很受欢迎，因为它们安全又美味。

en: Safety is what matters most.
zh: 安全是最重要的。

en: You should stay in bed.
zh: 你应该卧床休息。

en: Stay quiet and rest.
zh: 保持安静，好好休息。

en: I feel relieved.
zh: 我感到如释重负。

en: At ease.
zh: 请放松。

en: Set your mind at ease.
zh: 放宽心。

en: I'm managing scraping along on a small salary.
zh: 我靠微薄的薪水勉强度日。

en: To my relief, he came home safe and sound.
zh: 让我感到欣慰的是，他平安无事地回家了。

en: Easy living corrupted the warrior spirit.
zh: 安逸的生活腐蚀了武士精神。

en: Wishing you peace and happiness at Christmas.
zh: 祝您圣诞节平安快乐。

en: Any watch will do, so long as it's cheap.
zh: 随便什么手表都可以，只要便宜就行。

en: The cheap prices tempted me to buy things I didn't need.
zh: 低廉的价格诱使我购买了不需要的东西。

en: There was a glut of cotton goods due to cheap imports.
zh: 由于廉价进口商品，棉纺织品供过于求。

en: Cheap imports will glut the market.
zh: 廉价进口商品将充斥市场。

en: Do you know of any inexpensive stores?
zh: 你知道有什么便宜的商店吗？

en: It seemed to be cheap.
zh: 这东西看起来很便宜。

en: I saved on travelling expenses by staying at a cheap hotel.
zh: 我住在一个便宜的旅馆里，节省了旅行费用。

en: I bought it thinking it was cheap, but it was rotten, so I ended up losing out.
zh: 我以为它很便宜就买了，结果是坏的，所以我赔了本。

en: I want to buy this book not because it is cheap, but because it is useful.
zh: 我想买这本书不是因为它便宜，而是因为它有用。

en: I know a hole in the wall that's really cheap.
zh: 我知道一个很便宜的小餐馆。

en: The ayu season has opened.
zh: 香鱼季节已经开始了。

en: Having been wrongly addressed, the letter never reached him.
zh: 由于地址错误，这封信从未送到他手中。

en: An overwhelming majority voted to abolish the brutal punishment.
zh: 绝大多数人投票废除这种残酷的惩罚。

en: Send it to me as a compressed file.
zh: 请以压缩文件的形式发送给我。

en: Our eyes should meet when we shake hands.
zh: 我们握手时目光应该交汇。

en: Let's shake hands and be friends.
zh: 我们握手做朋友吧。

en: I have one final piece of advice related to handshakes: Remember to smile.
zh: 关于握手，我还有最后一条建议：记住要微笑。

en: Give me some skin!
zh: 击个掌吧！

en: Please shake hands.
zh: 请握手。

en: A closed fist can indicate stress.
zh: 紧握的拳头可能表示压力。

en: On bad roads this little car really comes into its own.
zh: 在糟糕的道路上，这辆小车真正发挥了它的优势。

en: The evil spirit was driven away from the house.
zh: 邪灵被从房子里赶走了。

en: Keep away from bad company.
zh: 远离坏朋友。

en: Try to avoid bad company.
zh: 尽量避免和坏人交往。

en: You should keep away from bad company.
zh: 你应该远离坏朋友。

en: The notorious rebel was ultimately captured and confined to jail.
zh: 臭名昭著的叛乱分子最终被抓获并被关进监狱。

en: The notorious dictator abused his privileges to his heart's content.
zh: 臭名昭著的独裁者尽情地滥用他的特权。

en: I had a nightmare.
zh: 我做了一个噩梦。

en: I feel as if I've woken up from a nightmare.
zh: 我觉得我好像从一场噩梦中醒来。

en: Devils are hiding among the rocks.
zh: 魔鬼藏在岩石之中。

en: Talk of devil, and he's presently at your elbow.
zh: 说曹操，曹操到。

en: When you talk of the devil you will hear his bones rattle.
zh: 说曹操，曹操到。

en: Talk of the devil and he is sure to appear.
zh: 说曹操，曹操到。

en: Speak of the devil and he is sure to appear.
zh: 说曹操，曹操到。

en: Give the devil his due.
zh: 公平对待恶人。

en: The Devil may come.
zh: 魔鬼可能会来。

en: It is not easy to get rid of bad habits.
zh: 改掉坏习惯不容易。

en: Bad weather will ground the plane.
zh: 恶劣的天气会使飞机停飞。

en: The bad weather delayed the plane for two hours.
zh: 恶劣的天气使飞机延误了两个小时。

en: Due to bad weather, the plane was late.
zh: 由于天气不好，飞机晚点了。

en: Due to bad weather, the plane arrived three hours late.
zh: 由于天气不好，飞机晚到了三个小时。

en: Bad weather prevented them from sailing.
zh: 恶劣的天气阻止了他们航行。

en: Bad weather discouraged them from going on a picnic.
zh: 恶劣的天气使他们不想去野餐。

en: I couldn't go out on account of the bad weather.
zh: 因为天气不好，我没能出去。

en: The bad weather frustrated our plans.
zh: 恶劣的天气破坏了我们的计划。

en: The bad weather prevented us from leaving.
zh: 恶劣的天气阻止了我们离开。

en: Owing to bad weather, I didn't go.
zh: 由于天气不好，我没去。

en: Because of the bad weather, my piano teacher suggested that I go home early.
zh: 因为天气不好，我的钢琴老师建议我早点回家。

en: Father was in a bad mood since he couldn't play golf because of bad weather.
zh: 因为天气不好，爸爸不能打高尔夫球，所以心情不好。

en: Due to the bad weather, the plane was ten minutes late.
zh: 由于天气不好，飞机晚点了十分钟。

en: Bad weather prevented me from setting out.
zh: 恶劣的天气阻止我出发。

en: Bad weather upset our plans to go on a hike.
zh: 恶劣的天气打乱了我们去徒步旅行的计划。

en: Thanks to the bad weather, the game was canceled.
zh: 多亏了这糟糕的天气，比赛取消了。

en: The senior citizens' spirits were high in spite of the bad weather.
zh: 尽管天气不好，老人们的精神头还是很好。

en: They made up their minds to go by car in spite of bad weather.
zh: 尽管天气不好，他们还是决定开车去。

en: Bad weather prevented us from starting.
zh: 恶劣的天气阻碍了我们的出发。

en: The plane was delayed on account of bad weather.
zh: 因为天气不好，飞机延误了。

en: Farmers suffered crop losses from poor weather.
zh: 农民因恶劣天气而遭受作物损失。

en: I gave up the idea of seeing the sights of the city because of the bad weather.
zh: 因为天气不好，我放弃了游览城市景点的想法。

en: Ill gained, ill spent.
zh: 不义之财，终将散尽。

en: The bad weather marred the ceremony.
zh: 恶劣的天气破坏了典礼。

en: Ill-gotten gains are short-lived. The only way to make real money is to earn every penny.
zh: 不义之财不会长久。 赚真钱的唯一方法是赚每一分钱。

en: Bad cold is prevailing throughout the country.
zh: 全国各地都流行着严重的感冒。

en: A serious form of flu prevails throughout the country.
zh: 一种严重的流感在全国蔓延。

en: I got sick.
zh: 我生病了。

en: Give credit where credit is due.
zh: 该表扬的就要表扬。

en: Bad habits are easy to get into.
zh: 坏习惯很容易养成。

en: A bad smell permeated the room.
zh: 一股难闻的气味弥漫在房间里。

en: The instant I open the lid an offensive smell greets my nose.
zh: 我一打开盖子，一股难闻的气味就扑鼻而来。

en: It is not easy to get rid of a bad habit.
zh: 改掉一个坏习惯不容易。

en: It's easy to fall into bad habits.
zh: 很容易染上坏习惯。

en: Bad drivers should have their licenses taken away from them.
zh: 应该吊销那些糟糕的驾驶员的驾照。

en: Malicious gossip spreads like wildfire. I guess that's why they say bad news travels fast.
zh: 恶意八卦像野火一样蔓延。 我想这就是为什么他们说坏消息传得快。

en: Well, they say bad news travels fast.
zh: 嗯，他们说坏消息传得快。

en: He committed one crime after another.
zh: 他接二连三地犯罪。

en: What one has sown one will have to reap.
zh: 种瓜得瓜，种豆得豆。

en: Murder will out.
zh: 纸包不住火。

en: Stop calling me names. That'll do you no good.
zh: 别再骂我了。 那对你没好处。

en: Far be it from me to criticize, but your dress is rather loud.
zh: 我不是想批评你，但你的裙子实在太扎眼了。

en: I meant no harm.
zh: 我没有恶意。

en: No offense was meant.
zh: 并无冒犯之意。

en: The bandits demanded all money in the register.
zh: 土匪们要求交出收银机里的所有钱。

en: Bad money drives out good.
zh: 劣币驱逐良币。

en: Is it getting worse?
zh: 情况在恶化吗？

en: The smaller the body, the more likely the person will suffer from the ill effects of radiation.
zh: 身体越小，人越容易受到辐射的有害影响。

en: Having hit a streak of bad luck, my fortune had gone to pot in no time.
zh: 倒霉事接踵而至，我的财产很快就挥霍一空了。

en: Come to the end of one's devil's luck.
zh: 好运到头了。

en: Have the devil's own luck.
zh: 运气好得不得了。

en: I meant you no harm.
zh: 我没有想伤害你。

en: It is a white lie.
zh: 这是一个善意的谎言。

en: There was no malice in what he did.
zh: 他所做的一切并无恶意。

en: Deliver us from evil.
zh: 远离邪恶。

en: You will be disliked by girls if you play practical jokes on them.
zh: 如果你捉弄女孩，你会不招女孩喜欢的。

en: Don't carry a practical joke too far.
zh: 不要把恶作剧开过头了。

en: Evil is easy, and has infinite forms.
zh: 作恶容易，而且形式多种多样。

en: Render good for evil.
zh: 以德报怨。

en: He is bad beyond correction.
zh: 他已经坏到无可救药了。

en: Not bad. But I'm a little tired.
zh: 还不错。不过我有点累。

en: Not bad.
zh: 不错。

en: Not bad. I can earn a good enough living.
zh: 还不错。我能挣到足够的生活费。

en: Evil sometimes wins.
zh: 邪恶有时会获胜。

en: Okay. Sorry.
zh: 好吧。对不起。

en: Bad as it was, it could have been worse.
zh: 虽然很糟糕，但情况可能更糟。

en: Don't keep bad company.
zh: 不要与坏人为伍。

en: The wicked witch cast a spell on the man and turned him into a bug.
zh: 邪恶的女巫对那个人施了魔法，把他变成了一只虫子。

en: Bad books will do you harm.
zh: 坏书会害了你。

en: I was also not a bad mother.
zh: 我也不是一个坏母亲。

en: Bad habits die hard.
zh: 恶习难改。

en: A bad habit, once formed, cannot easily be got rid of.
zh: 恶习一旦养成，就很难改掉。

en: "I caught a bad cold." "That's too bad."
zh: “我得了重感冒。”“真糟糕。”

en: I had a bad cold, and to make matters worse, it began snowing.
zh: 我得了重感冒，更糟糕的是，开始下雪了。

en: I can't get rid of a bad cold.
zh: 我摆脱不了重感冒。

en: Never associate with bad fellows.
zh: 永远不要和坏家伙交往。

en: Bad news travels fast.
zh: 坏消息传得很快。

en: Don't get involved with bad men.
zh: 不要和坏人混在一起。

en: Bad people are at the helm of the nation.
zh: 坏人当道。

en: You should make the best of a bad situation.
zh: 你应该在糟糕的情况下尽力而为。

en: It's hard to change a bad habit.
zh: 恶习难改。

en: It's very hard to get rid of bad habits.
zh: 恶习很难改掉。

en: How easily one acquires bad habits!
zh: 人多么容易染上恶习啊！

en: One acquires bad habits very easily.
zh: 人很容易染上恶习。

en: A bad habit is easily acquired.
zh: 恶习很容易养成。

en: Once you've got into a bad habit, it can be difficult to get out of it.
zh: 一旦染上恶习，就很难摆脱它。

en: A bad habit, once formed, is difficult to get rid of.
zh: 恶习一旦养成，就很难改掉。

en: Bad seed must produce bad corn.
zh: 坏种结不出好玉米。

en: I don't like bad boys.
zh: 我不喜欢坏男孩。

en: Some think it is a bad idea.
zh: 有些人认为这是个坏主意。

en: Better be half hanged than ill wed.
zh: 宁可半死，也不要婚姻不幸。

en: Ill news comes too soon.
zh: 坏消息总是来得太快。

en: Ill news comes apace.
zh: 坏消息传得很快。

en: It is, not I, but you, who are to blame.
zh: 该受责备的是你，不是我。

en: You won't regret it.
zh: 你不会后悔的。

en: It is you who is to blame.
zh: 该受责备的是你。

en: It is not you but I that am to blame.
zh: 该受责备的不是你，而是我。

en: It is I that am bad.
zh: 是我不好。

en: I'm afraid you don't.
zh: 恐怕你不会。

en: No need to worry.
zh: 不用担心。

en: Is there a problem?
zh: 有什么问题吗？

en: You have to apologize at once when you have done wrong.
zh: 做错了事要立刻道歉。

en: That which is evil is soon learned.
zh: 学坏容易。

en: To make matter worse, the traffic was bad.
zh: 更糟糕的是，交通很糟糕。

en: Do you think it a bad thing?
zh: 你认为这是件坏事吗？

en: Don't you think it a bad thing?
zh: 你不认为这是件坏事吗？

en: Don't be a bad boy.
zh: 别做坏孩子。

en: I take the liberty of going home.
zh: 我擅自回家了。

en: I'm sorry I can't go.
zh: 很抱歉，我不能去。

en: Sorry, but I can't go along with you.
zh: 抱歉，我不能和你一起去。

en: I'm sorry, I have another engagement.
zh: 很抱歉，我另有约会。

en: I really shouldn't ask, but could you go get some tofu for me?
zh: 真不该问，但你能帮我买点豆腐吗？

en: I'm sorry, but it's just not possible.
zh: 很抱歉，这根本不可能。

en: I have caught a bad cold.
zh: 我得了重感冒。

en: Aoi dances very well.
zh: 葵跳舞跳得很好。

en: Aoi is a very good dancer.
zh: 葵是个很棒的舞者。

en: What a good dancer Aoi is!
zh: 葵跳舞跳得真好啊！

en: How well Aoi dances!
zh: 葵跳舞跳得真棒！

en: Aoi dances well.
zh: 葵跳舞跳得很好。

en: We never meet without a parting.
zh: 天下没有不散的宴席。

en: Aoi's hobby is dancing.
zh: 葵的爱好是跳舞。

en: Aoi became a dancer.
zh: 葵成为了一名舞蹈演员。

en: Aoi dances.
zh: 葵跳舞。

en: Skip the pleasantries and get down to business.
zh: 别说客套话了，直接进入正题吧。

en: Greetings are the basis of good manners.
zh: 礼貌是良好举止的基础。

en: I was at a loss for an answer.
zh: 我一时语塞，不知如何回答。

en: Textile News has a large following among those working in the textile industry.
zh: 《纺织新闻》在纺织行业从业者中拥有大量的读者。

en: I'm dead to love.
zh: 我对爱情已经心如死灰。

en: Love is above money. The latter can't give as much happiness as the former.
zh: 爱情高于金钱。后者无法给予前者那么多的幸福。

en: Love blinded him to her faults.
zh: 爱情使他看不到她的缺点。

en: Burn with desire.
zh: 燃起欲望。

en: Love and hate are opposite emotions.
zh: 爱和恨是相反的情感。

en: You cannot live by love alone.
zh: 光有爱是活不下去的。

en: It is pleasant to watch a loving old couple.
zh: 看到一对恩爱的老夫妇真令人愉快。

en: I parted with my old car.
zh: 我卖掉了我的旧车。

en: Let's sing a patriotic air.
zh: 我们来唱一首爱国歌曲吧。

en: Many murders have been committed in the name of patriotism.
zh: 许多谋杀都是以爱国的名义犯下的。

en: The patriots stood up for the rights of their nation.
zh: 爱国者们挺身而出，维护他们国家的权利。

en: At last, Mario managed to win the princess's love.
zh: 最终，马里奥成功赢得了公主的爱。

en: My pet dog was seriously ill.
zh: 我的宠物狗病得很重。

en: Nothing is as precious as love.
zh: 没有什么比爱更珍贵了。

en: Love is something that you can neither snatch away nor express.
zh: 爱是既无法掠夺也无法言说的东西。

en: But love can break your heart.
zh: 但是爱会让你心碎。

en: Love me little, love me long.
zh: 爱我少一点，爱我久一点。

en: Charity begins at home.
zh: 慈善始于家庭。

en: Ai finds it difficult to make friends with Ken.
zh: 艾发现很难和肯交朋友。

en: Love undeniably has wings to fly away from love, but it's also undeniable that it also has wings to fly back.
zh: 爱无疑有翅膀可以飞离爱，但不可否认的是，它也有翅膀可以飞回来。

en: Love, which is a wonderful feeling, comes to everyone at some time in their life.
zh: 爱，这是一种美好的感觉，会在人生的某个时刻降临到每个人身上。

en: Love makes the world go round.
zh: 爱让世界运转。

en: Love moves in mysterious ways.
zh: 爱以神秘的方式运行。

en: What is life without the radiance of love?
zh: 没有爱的光辉，生命还有什么意义？

en: Love and Peace.
zh: 爱与和平。

en: We hope we will make our home full of love and happiness.
zh: 我们希望我们的家充满爱和幸福。

en: Love is seeing her in your dreams.
zh: 爱就是在梦中看到她。

en: I didn't marry her because I loved her.
zh: 我娶她不是因为我爱她。

en: How difficult a thing it is, to love, and to be wise, and both at once.
zh: 爱，理智，两者兼得，是多么困难的一件事啊。

en: It is easy to love, but hard to be loved.
zh: 爱很容易，但被爱很难。

en: My love for you won't let me tell you everything. Some things are better left unsaid.
zh: 我对你的爱不允许我告诉你一切。有些事情最好还是不说。

en: To love and to be loved is the greatest happiness.
zh: 爱和被爱是最大的幸福。

en: It is the greatest happiness in life to love and to be loved.
zh: 人生最大的幸福就是爱和被爱。

en: Don't mourn over the loss of your loved one too long.
zh: 不要为失去你爱的人而悲伤太久。

en: There is more pleasure in loving than in being loved.
zh: 爱比被爱更快乐。

en: It is sad not to be loved, but it is much sadder not to be able to love.
zh: 不被爱是可悲的，但不能爱更可悲。

en: It is love that rules the world.
zh: 是爱统治着世界。

en: As long as we love each other, we'll be all right.
zh: 只要我们彼此相爱，我们就会没事的。

en: Faults are thick where love is thin.
zh: 爱淡薄的地方，缺点就多。
